q1.title:
What do you want to do 
first after arriving in Australia?

options.1:
Find a place where you can study or 
work on your own projects
options.2:
Can't wait to join the school's 
orientation and meet new friends
options.3:
Search for job opportunities 
near your home
options.4:
Explore the city and 
visit interesting places

q2.title:
How would you like to 
spend an ordinary weekend?

options.1:
Stay at home to finish assignments 
or review coursework
options.2:
Join various activities or 
hang out with friends

q3.title:
What if you don't 
understand the class content?

options.1:
Immediately seeking for 
additional learning resources
options.2: Form a study group with classmates
options.3:
Ask classmates or solve 
it quickly by yourself
options.4:
Take a break to relax before 
tackling the problem again

q4.title:
A friend invites you to eat 
after class. What do you do?

options.1: Maybe not this time, I have another class later, I'll go home to prepare
options.2: Why not! Hanging out with friends is more fun than attending class
options.3: Sure, but I might have to leave early because I have work later
options.4:
No problem! Should we 
catch a movie after eating?

q5.title:
What would you do if your 
school offers internships?

options.1:
Study hard to enhance professional 
knowledge and improve grades
options.2:
Choose internships, it helps me 
build skills and network
options.3:
Choose internships that enhances 
skills and offers salary
options.4:
Choose internships that 
balance work and travel

q6.title:
How would you plan for 
the upcoming long holiday?

options.1:
Catch up on all my coursework and
 get ahead on future classes
options.2: I want to hang out with friends
options.3:
Work for more shifts 
or just rest at home
options.4: Travel to another city and having fun!

q7.title:
How do you handle friends'
 invite before a report due?

options.1: Sorry guys I don't have time
options.2: I'll do it after coming back
options.3: I'll join if I finish on time

q8.title:
How would you choose your 
groupmates for a group project?

options.1:
I wanna team up with classmates who 
are serious and responsible
options.2:
I'll team up with friends or 
classmates I get along with
options.3:
Priority goes to classmates 
with work experience
options.4:
I want to team up with easy-going 
people, the process should be fun!

q9.title:
What would you do if 
you fall behind in class?

options.1:
I'll probably spend the next week 
catching up on everything I've missed
options.2:
Ask others how they're doing 
and seek their advice
options.3:
I need to take fewer work 
shifts to catch up...
options.4:
Don't stress too much, get a 
bubble tea to relax first

q10.title:
You're invited to join a 
club, how would you respond?

options.1:
I'll join if the club is related 
to my studies
options.2:
I'll join! It's a great way to make new 
friends and expand my network
options.3:
I'll join if the club's schedule 
doesn't conflict with my work
options.4: I'll join if the club activities are fun.

q11.title:
What do you do when 
you feel homesick?

options.1:
Focus on my studies and 
try to keep myself busy
options.2:
Hang out, eat, drink, and chat with 
friends to alleviate homesickness
options.3:
Work harder, stay positive, 
and start planning my next visit home
options.4:
Find some food from home 
or listen to music to relax

q12.title:
How do you interact with 
classmates from other cultures?

options.1:
I would interact with them with 
respect to their cultures
options.2:
Share culture with classmates and 
hang out with them to build friendships
options.3:
Seek for cooperation opportunities, 
leveraging the culture differences
options.4:
Find interesting aspects of their culture 
to make interactions more enjoyable.

q13.title:
What would you do 
after knowing ISIA?

options.1: I find some content about Australian schools interesting, so I follow it
options.2:
I see networking events, I'll follow 
and might join to meet new friends
options.3:
It's part of Australia Career Forum, 
I'll follow it for long-term benefits
options.4:
Everything looks fun, I'll definitely 
follow and participate in their activities!
